constructor.details: The contract automatically disables initializers when deployed so that nobody can highjack the implementation contract.

convexRewardPool().notice: The address of the convex reward pool.

curveLpToken().notice: The address of the curve LP token.

curvePool().notice: The address of the curve pool.

indexUint().notice: The indexUint flag. If true, the adapter will use uint256(uint128(index)) for calc_withdraw_one_coin.

multiPoolStrategy().notice: The address of the MultiPoolStrategy contract.

tokensLength().notice: The number of tokens in the curve pool.

underlyingToken().notice: The address of the underlying token.

underlyingTokenPoolIndex().notice: The index of the underlying token in the curve pool.

useEth().notice: The useEth flag. If true, the adapter will wrap/unwrap ETH.

zapper().notice: The zapper contract if pool is a meta pool.

documentation.text: @notice The address of the curve pool.
@notice The address of the MultiPoolStrategy contract.
@notice The address of the curve LP token.
@notice The address of the convex reward pool.
@notice The address of the underlying token.
@notice The index of the underlying token in the curve pool.
@notice The number of tokens in the curve pool.
@notice The zapper contract if pool is a meta pool.
@notice The useEth flag. If true, the adapter will wrap/unwrap ETH.
@notice The indexUint flag. If true, the adapter will use uint256(uint128(index)) for calc_withdraw_one_coin.

@dev The contract automatically disables initializers when deployed so that nobody can highjack the
 implementation contract.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct ConvexPoolAdapter.RewardData memory[] memory)
